faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subheading: Quick answers to common questions about Kitloop
faq.q1: Is Kitloop for rental providers or end customers?
faq.a1: Kitloop is designed for rental operators (reservations, inventory, check-out, returns).
faq.q2: Can Kitloop track inventory by individual items?
faq.a2: Yes, inventory is tracked as individual equipment items with status (e.g. available/rented/maintenance).
faq.a3: Reservations can include deposit amounts and track their status.
faq.q4: Can you handle damage on return?
faq.a4: Returns can include photo documentation of damage and close the reservation with a record.
faq.a5: Team roles are owner / staff / viewer, with different permissions.
faq.q6: How do I import data from a spreadsheet into Kitloop?
faq.a6: Inventory can be imported from CSV.
faq.a7: Kitloop is currently in MVP testing phase. MVP access is free for outdoor gear rental providers.

about.title: About Us

why_kitloop.title: Why Kitloop Was Created
why_kitloop.paragraph1: Kitloop started as a fictional business for a university marketing course. But instead of creating something random, I looked at a real problem: at home, we had tons of outdoor gear that we used only once or twice a year. Meanwhile, people kept buying new things.
why_kitloop.paragraph2: That's how the idea was born ‚Äî a platform where rental providers and individuals could offer their gear online, all in one place.
why_kitloop.paragraph3: We believe the gear rental market urgently needs digitalization ‚Äî and this is our answer.

founder.title: About the Founder
founder.paragraph1: Hi! I'm Martin Kozojed ‚Äì a student of tourism, outdoor enthusiast, and technology lover.
founder.paragraph2: I created Kitloop because I wanted to combine all the things I care about: nature, community, and smart digital solutions.
founder.paragraph3: I believe gear should be accessible, not owned. Kitloop is my way of making that happen.
